snippet: How jurors in the corruption trial of Mr. Silver, the former New York State Assembly speaker, perceive the connection between him and Dr. Robert N. Taub could be crucial in determining his fate.
abstract: Federal prosecutors in corruption trial of former New York State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver have focused on relationship he had with Dr Robert N Traub, oncologist who regularly referred patients to law firm Weitz & Luxenberg, which employed Silver; whether jurors perceive relationship as unseemly or corrupt will likely be pivotal in determining outcome of case.
lead_paragraph: How jurors in the corruption trial of Mr. Silver, the former New York State Assembly speaker, perceive the connection between him and Dr. Robert N. Taub could be crucial in determining his fate.

headline.main: Friends or Friendly? Sheldon Silver’s Trial Focuses on Ties to Doctor
headline.print_headline: Friends or Just Friendly? Corruption Trial Focuses on Silver’s Ties to Oncologist
